intro: Vangueria uhligii, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Vangueria uhligii is typically found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
